debugMode.description: Prints all stored variables at end of program

displayTime.description: Get time needed to run program at end.

timerWarning.description: Warn if a program is taking too long to run.

delimiter.description:
The value used to assign values to a variable.
Normally it is an arrow, but some people may prefer an = or a different variant of an arrow. For multiple delimiters, add them to a list and seperate by commas: eg, ['<-', '=']

mutableParameters.description: Variables assigned to parameters are modified when calling procedures / functions (note: this is not normal program behavior in most languages, but pseudocode does this so I included this setting - for fancy terms, 0 setting refers to pass by value: the value is copied by parameter variable which is used like a local variable and then destroyed at the end of the procedure (normal procedure behavior in python and C), and 1 setting is pass-by-reference: the variables are modified within the procedure when you add them as parameters (this is a default in older languages like pascal)
